review: Works as advertised.  In addition to plugging in to an HDMI slot, I also plug it in to AC power via the provided power cord.  My only real beef is that the unit gets VERY warm, even when not being used.  I suspect it is drawing quite a lot of current, so I don't keep it plugged in continuously.

Podemos proyectar videos en la TV desde la tablet o la laptop mientras se trabaja en otras cosas. Trabaja muy bien con YouTube y si bien se puede proyectar el contenido del desktop de la laptop o cualquier otro video, esta aplicación aún no trabaja bien.

review: I use these all over the house for streaming PLEX and Netflix from android phones and android tablets.  Just for reference I have tried AppleTV (also PLEX) and Roku (failure - it didn't even work on half the TV's I have that were about 5 years old). This thing works everywhere and the picture is superb.  Could not possibly be happier with a $35 device!
author: R. Burrowes

review: I bought the chromecase device a couple of months ago after returning another Miracast device. The device is amazing. Here is what i like about it1. Price: It is the lowest price in the market2. Setup: The setup is extremely easy and it is straightforward3. functionality: When you try to stream a video from Youtube or Netflix, it does not just stream your browser screen, instead there is an app on the device that will connect directly to the service and stream the video. What this enables me to do is to leverage my computer to search (better than any smart tv app) and then turn my computer off once i start the streaming4. Idle state: The chrmoecast will act as a screen saver with very nice nature picture. Sometime i feel like leaving my TV on all the time :)
